Class IntegrationView

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.integration.view.IntegrationView
public class IntegrationView extends Object
View class for handling user interactions and displaying messages. Provides methods for displaying errors, integration formatting guidance, and input prompts.
Version:
3.0 final
Author:
Sebastian Legierski InfK4

  • Method Details

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage(String message)
      Displays a general informational message.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed.

    • displayError

      public void displayError(String error)
      Displays error messages.
      Parameters:
      error - The error message to be displayed.

    • displayCorrectFormatting

      public void displayCorrectFormatting()
      Displays correct formatting guidelines for input arguments.

    • displayResult

      public void displayResult(double result)
      Displays the result of the integration calculation.
      Parameters:
      result - The integration result to be displayed.

    • selectMode

      public char selectMode()
      Prompts the user to select a mode for integration ('d' for divisions or 'w' for width). Repeats until a valid input is provided.
      Returns:
      The selected mode as a character ('d' or 'w').

    • getInt

      public int getInt(String text)
      Prompts the user to enter an integer value for divisions. Repeats until a valid integer is provided.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be displayed before the input prompt.
      Returns:
      The number of divisions as an integer.

    • getDouble

      public double getDouble(String text)
      Prompts the user to enter a double value for bounds or width. Repeats until a valid double is provided.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be displayed before the input prompt.
      Returns:
      The entered value as a double.

    • getFunction

      public String getFunction()
      Prompts the user to enter a polynomial function.
      Returns:
      The polynomial function as a String.
